name: Loews Royal Pacific Resort at Universal Orlando

reviews.title: Location Location
reviews.text: This was our first trpmto the USA and Universal. We are already planning to our next trip planned for Jan 2013.

reviews.title: Lovely Stay
reviews.text: This resort is great. I liked the following aspects:

reviews.title: Great family hotel
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious, considering we were 4 in the room (2 kids)

reviews.title: Outdated 3 1/2 stars
reviews.text: The pool area was awesome with well kept gardens surounding the area

reviews.title: Nice stay...
reviews.text: Restaurants were a bit pricey but we ate out at Universal, which has a large selection.

What a great property!! For my sister's birthday we took a trip to the universal parks (Universal studios, Islands of Adventure, City Walk) and we decided to stay at this resort. What a great property this is. The convenience of staying at a property that is literally walking distance to the Universal parks without having to worry about parking is fantastic!! You park your car in the hotel parking lot, and you can either walk or ride a small taxi boat (free of charge) that drops you off right in the middle of City Walk. The boats come & go every 15 minutes or so... so you're never waiting too long to take one. If you don't feel like waiting for a boat you can always walk back & forth on the walkway that follows the route that the boats take. The room we stayed in was VERY comfortable. The breakfast was great!! (Try the hawaiian pancakes!! hahaha) They offer a breakfast buffet if you're really hungry. It's a little pricey, but well worth it.
reviews.title: A MUST if you're planning on going to the universal parks!

likes.disliked: — It's a bit pricey, but well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have to say that one of the coolest parts about staying in this hotel is that your room keys double as your express passes for the rides at universal. What exactly does that mean? Well, quite simply it means you don't have to wait in the long lines! you can jump on the express line and your wait is literally cut by 50% or more! We went into rides where the wait time was listed as 60 minutes.... We got in the express line and we were on the ride and out within about 15 minutes. It's like you're getting some kind of VIP treatment. Being a Florida resident and a frequent visitor to the theme parks around the summer time I know that Orlando in the summer is when the parks are most crowded with both Florida residents and out-of-towners. Being able to get on a ride in that short amount of time is phenomenal! Another great thing about the express passes is you can keep them even after you've checked out. The room keys have your name & dates of your stay shown on them so if you are planning on going to the parks for 2 days but you're only staying in the hotel for 1 you can still use your room key as an express pass on the 2nd day... even if you've already checked out of your room.
reviews.title: Loved the Express Pass system, didn't love the slamming doors

likes.liked: — Using room keys as Universal park Express Passes

reviews.text: Overall this was a great experience! I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is planning a trip to the Universal parks. It's a little more expensive than economy hotels in the area, but the conveniences are worth the extra money... but don't take my word for it... try it out for yourself. I'm sure you won't regret it.... your wallet might.... but you won't. hahahaha
reviews.title: Great Service and a Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I did a LOT of research before choosing a hotel (it's very rare that we get an opportunity to leave the two kids at home with family and get away by ourselves for five nights). We read reviews of many hotels on many different travel sites, asked for recommendations from all our friends who had visited Orlando recently, considered all kinds of different options (renting a vacation home, vacation condo, budget hotel, luxury hotel, etc.). We finally decided on the Royal Pacific because we planned on spending a lot of time at the two Universal Parks and wanted to use Express Passes to bypass the long lines; of the three Universal hotels whose room keys act as Express Passes, the Royal Pacific had the lowest prices.
reviews.title: what a rippoff

reviews.text: The trip itself was fantastic. The hotel part of the trip was so-so. Here are the good and bad things about the hotel (the first Con is the most important thing to read, in my opinion):
reviews.title: Best of the Universal Loews Hotels

likes.liked: — The close proximity to Universal and express pass access; the great staff

reviews.text: One of the best hotels in Orlando, great atmosphere, clean rooms, big pool, fun activities for kids, and walking distance to universal studios and islands of adventure.
reviews.title: AAA loves it

likes.disliked: — The ducks that were swimming in the pool

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights at the Royal Pacific with family of 5 (kids 13, 9, 6) in July 2008. We're normally Disney-people, but wanted to give Universal a try this year (first time). Here's our scoop:
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about Royal Pacific

reviews.text: First, the good: Lobby area of the hotel was beautiful. Our rooms were decent sized (not huge, but larger than a value resort at Disney), clean, nice pool area. Each day there were kids activities at the pool (limbo, diving for sea creatures, short games to keep the kids entertained). Nice, friendly pool staff. If you are going to the Universal parks, it's very convenient to get there. You park your car at the resort, then can walk or take a 5 minute boat ride to the resort. We never waited more than 10 min for the boat, The biggest plus to staying at Royal Pacific is the Express Pass which basically gives you front of line privileges at both Universal parks. As other travellers have noted (and which we doubted until we experienced it) we never had to wait more than 15 minutes for even the busiest rides. Fantastic advantage.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Now, the con: We were not overwhelmed with the service at Royal Pacific. Despite being Loew'sFirst members, this wasn't recorded when we checked in (and we never received the "gift" you were supposed to receive). We had some problems with check-in and the clerk indicated she didn't have a record of my request (luckily, I had print-outs). Not a great first impression, especially at 11pm at night when very tired from travelling. When we checked in our room, the connecting door was open to the room next door (we locked it) and then it occured again on a subsequent day when we returned from the parks. We also never had the room cleaned on another day (skipped entirely). Be prepared to pay for everything at Royal Pacific. Parking is $15/day tacked on the bill, you can't use luggage carts, there are no inexpensive food options. This is all nitpicky stuff, I realize, and is nothing horrible, but we're used to Disney's level of service, convenience and overall ambiance of friendliness which just wasn't there.
reviews.title: An Amazing Stay

likes.liked: — Grounds, free express pass, rooms, pool, service
likes.disliked: — Parking fee, Islands Dining Room, no slide, hot tubs overlooking private cabanas

reviews.text: Overall, it was nice to try something new and if you're going to Universal - it was worth being on-site for the Express Privileges. Now that we've tried it, we'll be heading back to the Disney side of the world next year.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel

likes.liked: — The quality of the service and the level of comfort.
likes.disliked: — The price of a drink in the pool bar costs twice as much as inside in the hotel bar.No obvious reason when plastic glasses are used and seating facilities are

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for Fall Break. We stayed two nights and chose this hotel because of the early admission to Islands of Adventure and the Express Pass for the Rides. The hotel is beautiful and really quiet. We spent a little more and stayed on the Club level which was well worth it. The Club level features a hospitality room which has a wonderful breakfast, snacks, soft drinks, happy hour appetizers, and evening desserts. The staff in the hospitality room were so helpful with suggestions. We ended up eating our breakfasts and our dinner (at Happy Hour) in the hospitality room. The pool was wonderful. We swam at night, and the kids loved the water cannons. Afterward, we went upstairs, picked up dessert and soft drinks, and headed to the room. Our room was a little small. There was not enough room to keep our big suitcase open which was frustrating. But the rooms were clean and decorated nicely. It also featured a Keurig coffee maker. We loved being able to go to the Park early (Harry Potter land!), and the Express Passes for the Rides was the only way to go!!! We walked to the Park and it took less than 10 minutes - they had water taxis but we were never on the right schedule to get one. By staying at this hotel, we were able to have all of our park purchases (mainly during our trip in Harry Potter land) delivered to our room so we didn't have to carry those bags with us all day. The next time we go to Universal, we will stay here again on the Club level.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a Universal Studio Vacation

reviews.text: My family stayed here while visiting the Universal Studios' Wizarding World of Harry Potter. My daughter has extensive food restrictions-she won't go into anaphalactic shock if she eats the wrong items but the wrong foods will make her feel very ill and aggravate other medical issues she has. I called in advance and spoke to a concierge who was able to give me the name of a local shopping service (WeGoShop.com-thanks Amy!)so we could obtain and store foods my daughter is allowed to eat. This hotel has compact refrigerators available to place in rooms for a fee-which they gave to us no charge. The concierge, Dee, told me what restaurants in the theme parks had kitchens and to let the chefs know our needs at the host stand. Then she contacted the hotel dining room and let them know our specifications-when we arrived in the Islands Dining Room for our dinner reservation the chefs were ready to take care of us! Chef Herbert made us fabulous Stir Fry with the foods on the "safe" list. The day of our departure we were poolside and wanted to order lunch. Our waiter, Darryl, walked with me to the kitchen to make sure our food was prepared correctly and once again Chef Herbert made fantastic food that also happened to be safe. The only drawback to this property for me is that smoking is allowed in designated areas and we would prefer to be completely smoke-free. The outstanding service and great attitudes of everyone on property: doorman, bellman, front desk, concierge, universal ticket counter, and operator made this a great way to take the kids to Harry Potter!
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodation of Food Restrictions!

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights mid Oct. We had a great time. Check In was easy and room was clean & quiet. Our kids (11 & 13) really enjoyed the pool.
reviews.title: Beautiful & Convenient Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice having the early admission to the parks and Express Passes, though it wasn't too busy at the parks when we were there.
reviews.title: Going that extra mile makes all the difference......

reviews.text: We enjoyed the water taxis to the City Walk, although the walk isn't too far.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it for the early admission to IofA alone

reviews.text: We had just left a 4 day stay at Disney, so maybe our expectations were very high and expected more. When we arrived at Disney's Port Orleans at 11 AM, we were given our rooms right away although they were not connected. No matter, there was only 1 room between us. When we arrived at the Royal Pacific at 11:30AM which was well earlier than check in, we were told that although our room was not ready we could use the pool and facilities. No problem, we were early. My cousin was notified by 2 PM that her room was ready, but because the kids were having such fun at the pool, we decided to wait until I also got the call. At 3:45, my call came and we both went up to redo our check in. Although we requested rooms close to each other, the hotel insisted that we needed to be in different wings. Then after talking to a manager, we were given the same building, but different floors. Finally, we were given the same floor, but at diffent ends. It is quite surprising that a hotel with 1000 rooms cannot accomodate such a simple request. I really did not feel that my request to be close by is unreasonable or over the top. My cousin got to her room and her beds were not made. By this time it was 4:30. We were assured that by the time she walked back, the room would be finished. The managers (plural because we got to speak with 3) could have easily remedied the situation by finding us closer rooms. Again, they have 1000 rooms! They could have comped us a drink at the bar or an icecream for our kids and it may have made the situation more bearable, however, all they did was give us a glassy look of "there is not more I can do". The rest of stay was fine. Nice amenities. It seems though that everyone has their job and do not do more than that. A tissue was on the floor outside of my room when I arrived. Although there were night maids, maintenance workers, bell hops, etc, walking by all night and morning, it was not picked up until early afternoon. Small touches like that make a difference. Loews has a bit to learn from Disney!
reviews.title: needs some improvements, but overall nice

reviews.text: Stayed here with 3 teenagers for 2 nites end of June. We stayed for the Express passes. Hotel is beautiful. The fountain area is very pretty. Check in was quick and effortless. We had club rooms and the food was really good... snacks in the afternoon, drinks, desserts, etc. Breakfast pastries were great. The rooms themselves were very nice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - passes are worth the money

reviews.text: You can walk to the Universal Parks or take the boat (it shut down a lot since we had lots of lightening - but walking is quick).
reviews.title: If you go to the Universal Theme Parks you must stay at one of their hotels

reviews.text: The pool is much smaller than it looks on the website but there were plenty of chairs. Pool service was iffy - but no big deal.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — Charges for parking and mini bar

reviews.text: The longest we waited in any line was 12 minutes - and that was for an attraction with a listed wait of 90 minutes (Simpsons) so you cannot beat he convenience of the passes.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

likes.disliked: — Having to leave and return home.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in April 2008 for a work conference, so I'm not going to mention price because it doesn't affect my opinion of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice resort hotel

likes.liked: — The proximity and convenience of Universal Studios and Island of Adventure
likes.disliked: — Slow internet and no desk space

reviews.text: Shuttle from airport
reviews.title: Best Bet for Universal Orlando

likes.liked: — Location to the theme parks and using the room key as an express pass

reviews.text: If you've ever been to the Orlando airport, Mears Transportation is a popular shuttle that services most Orlando hotels. We took the shuttle and it was about an hour ride because the Royal Pacific was the last stop, not because the hotel is particularly far from the airport.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Check-in
reviews.title: A Tropical paradise

likes.liked: — The large pool and tropical gardens. And the front of the line pass at the themeparks
likes.disliked: — Quite long walk to the elevators from our room.

reviews.text: I've stayed at many hotels all over the country. Some hotels require deposits, some don't. Some charge you for the whole stay up front, some don't. What I've never encountered before was what happened at the Royal Pacific. First, they wanted one night's deposit at the time of booking. Fine. But when I checked in, they also wanted payment for the entire stay at that time. What? On top of that, they had no more king rooms available, even though my room had been booked three months in advance. I heard horror stories of other conference attendees who had booked two rooms, then been told at check-in that the reservation was only for one room and they were sold out. So these poor girls had to share. When they mentioned it to the conference organizer, he went with them to the front desk and suddenly, they "found" another room available (directly across the hall from the first room - how convenient).
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Loews Royal Pacific Resort is fantastic! Beautiful scenery with palm trees and fountains everywhere. The room was great - perfect sized - not small as others have commented. The pool area is amazing - lush greens - hot tub - bar/snack/food area - and the workers are genuinely friendly throughout the hotel. You can walk to Universal along an amazingly landscaped trail, or take the short boat ride which parallels the walking trail - all along looking at stunning scenery. If you plan your vacation around Universal, I highly, highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Great hotel! Great vacation!

reviews.text: Loews is nicely located next to Universal Studios and has easy access to the themepark which is good. Also it has a nice pool area (very kid friendly) which anyone travelling with a family would like. Prices are on the steep side but that is expected when you stay at a resort like this. Rooms are decent sized and quite clean.
reviews.title: Typical Resort Prices and Terrible Service

reviews.text: The issues this place has are its food and its service. Both are severly lacking.
reviews.title: Convenient location, poor service

reviews.text: Showering at peak times means you have no hot water, also my shower sent half the water through the bath pipe (shower over bath). I was told both of these issue would be looked into. Still waiting.
reviews.title: Great place and worth it!

reviews.text: Also I am not really that picky on food but Loews was the worst I have come across in the US, from the inability to cook steak fries so they weren't raw and crunchy in the middle to regular fries coming cold not once, but 4 times during the stay. For the other meals the less said the better. People I was travelling with actually went to the boardwalk and raved about the Hard Rock Cafe food compared to the hotel if that helps any. Even Emmerils Chop Choup was disappointing with long waits and food that really didn't live up to the reputation.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting but average room for the price.

reviews.text: My husband had a week-long management course in Orlando in September. We (9-year-old son and I) decided to join him mid-week for a mini vacation. We had free passes for Universal Studios, and my niece (who works at Disney) got us into Magic Kingdom for free. Good deal all around!
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: We stayed at the Loews Royal Pacific Resort at Universal Orlando. Even though we're not fans of big resorts (we prefer more intimate hotels), we thought the resort was nice enough, the food was really good and the staff was super nice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel let down by noise and no security at night

reviews.text: On our first night in Orlando, guess who we ran into? Scooby Doo! We were having dinner at the Islands Dining Room restaurant when Scooby Doo stopped by to say hi. Our son had a kick out of it.
reviews.title: Convenient location, great amenities, and reasonably priced rooms make this hotel the perfect choice.

reviews.text: The majority of our meals were at the resort's Islands Dining Room restaurant (good food, big portions). We had dinner one night at Jake's American Bar (located at the resort as well, food was very good too).
reviews.title: Great place to visit Universal

reviews.text: There are several advantages to staying on Universal property. You can take a free water taxi to Universal Studios and Islands of Adventure. Your room key allows you to go to the Fast Lane for all the rides. We thought Islands of Adventure was a lot of fun but found Universal Studios to be a bit lame.
reviews.title: Excellent

aka: Loews Royal Pacific Resort At Universal Orlando Hotel
description: Experience the allure of the South Seas at Loews Royal Pacific Resort at Universal Orlando® Feel the excitement of a time when adventurous travelers first island-hopped the South Pacific, relaxing along their journey at magnificent resorts where they could just kick back and enjoy the beauty of the islands. You can dine on exceptional cuisine; delight in the impeccable service; and soak in the breathtaking splendor of lush tropical surroundings at a white sandy beach of the lagoon-style swimming pool; all while enjoying the latest in modern conveniences. Hotel guests also enjoy an exclusive package of theme park benefits, including:* Early Park Admission† to Islands of Adventure, one hour before the theme park opens (valid theme park admission required)* Universal Express ride access* to skip the regular lines throughout both theme parks - a FREE benefit worth up to $87 per person, per day^ (valid theme park admission required)* Complimentary water taxis or shuttle buses to make getting around the resort fast and easy so you can make the most of your time * And more
